intro: Plectranthus hereroensis, commonly known as the Herero plectranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value and adaptability make it a popular plant among gardeners in arid and semi-arid regions.
